name: Grookey
flavorText: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

name: Scorbunny

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.

name: Sobble

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

name: Meowth V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Draw a card.

name: Meowth VMAX
text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Gold Rush
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

name: Rillaboom

ability.name: Voltage Beat
ability.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

name: Frosmoth

ability.name: Ice Dance
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.

flavorText: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

name: Galarian Perrserker

ability.name: Steely Spirit
ability.text: Your Metal Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

name: Cinccino

ability.name: Make Do
ability.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Its body secrets oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won't tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

name: Gossifleur

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

name: Wooloo

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

name: Morpeko

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

name: Galarian Ponyta

attacks.name: Heal Pulse
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: Its small horn hides a healing power. With a few rubs from this Pokémon's horn, any slight wound you have will be healed.

name: Rillaboom V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Forest Feast
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Grass Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Cinderace V

ability.name: Field Runner
ability.text: If a Stadium is in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

name: Inteleon V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Snipe Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

name: Toxtricity V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Venom Slap
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Zacian V

ability.name: Intrepid Sword
ability.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Put the other cards into your hand. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brave Blade
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Zamazenta V

ability.name: Dauntless Shield
ability.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon VMAX.

text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Assault Tackle
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

name: Polteageist V

ability.name: Teapot of Surprises
ability.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if it is Knocked Out), choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and puts it on the bottom of their deck.

text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Flapple

ability.name: Apple Drop
ability.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

name: Luxray

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Luxio during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

name: Coalossal

ability.name: Tar Generator
ability.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Fire Energy card, a Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Garbodor

ability.name: Poisonous Puddle
ability.text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

flavorText: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

name: Mantine

attacks.name: Water Reserve
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.

name: Noctowl

attacks.name: Carry Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. They shuffle that Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck. Then, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

flavorText: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

name: Duraludon

attacks.name: Steel Beam
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 40 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

name: Rayquaza

attacks.name: Jaw Lock
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.

name: Copperajah V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adamantine Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Morpeko

attacks.name: Famished
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

name: Zacian

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Blade
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.

name: Zamazenta

ability.name: Sturdy Shield
ability.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.

name: Decidueye

ability.name: Deep Forest Camo
ability.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX.

attacks.name: Splitting Arrow
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye's shots never miss.

name: Arctozolt

ability.name: Biting Whirlpool
ability.text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

flavorText: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

name: Hydreigon

ability.name: Dark Squall
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Darkness Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.

name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Rally Back
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

flavorText: You shouldn't get close to the child when it's playing outside its mother's pouch. Its mother is always nearby watching over it.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

name: Hatenna

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

name: Flareon

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon's body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

name: Galarian Sirfetch'd V

ability.name: Resolute Spear
ability.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may move any amount of Fighting Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Meteor Smash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Eternatus V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Power Accelerator
attacks.text: You may attach a Darkness Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamax Cannon
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Eternatus VMAX

ability.name: Eternal Zone
ability.text: If all of your Pokémon in play are Darkness type, you can have up to 8 Pokémon on your Bench, and you can't put non-Darkness Pokémon into play. (If this Ability stops working, discard Pokémon from your Bench until you have 5.)

text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dread End
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Darkness Pokémon in play.

name: Eldegoss

attacks.name: Blessing of Fluff
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

name: Drednaw

attacks.name: Vise Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Jaw Lock
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

flavorText: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

name: Centiskorch

attacks.name: Hundred Foot Flames
attacks.text: For each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

name: Dubwool V

ability.name: Soft Wool
ability.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

name: Charizard V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Lapras

attacks.name: Aqua Wash
attacks.text: You may put 2 Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

flavorText: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

name: Gengar

ability.name: Life Shaker
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Psychic Pokémon to another of your Psychic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar's doing.

name: Machamp

attacks.name: Macho Revenge
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Fighting Pokémon in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Dynamite Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

flavorText: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

name: Coalossal

ability.name: Tar Generator
ability.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Fire Energy card, a Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Hatterene V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Confounding Pulse
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mental Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Confused, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Morpeko V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Electro Wheel
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Grimmsnarl V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spiky Knuckle
attacks.text: Put 2 Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

name: Alcremie

attacks.name: Decorate
attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.

name: Galarian Obstagoon

ability.name: Untamed Shout
ability.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Obstruct
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

flavorText: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

name: Duraludon

attacks.name: Metal Sharpener
attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

name: Pikachu V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Circle Circuit
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Eternatus V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Power Accelerator
attacks.text: You may attach a Darkness Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamax Cannon
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Eevee V
text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Charizard

ability.name: Battle Sense
ability.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other cards.

attacks.name: Royal Blaze
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Leon card in your discard pile.

flavorText: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

name: Donphan

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.

name: Snorlax

ability.name: Gormandize
ability.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

name: Lugia

attacks.name: Wind Pressure
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or fewer cards in their hand, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

name: Grookey

attacks.name: Full On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

name: Scorbunny

attacks.name: Me First
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.

name: Vaporeon

ability.name: Watery Shroud
ability.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: When Vaporeon's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

name: Sobble

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attacks won't be able to resist weeping.

name: Special Delivery Pikachu

attacks.name: Happy Delivery
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.
